channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: エル・UKのEICケニア・ハントが、年間149ポンドの会員制プログラム「エル・コレクティブ」でニューススタンドの収入減を補う方法、雑誌の将来などについてQ&A（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
Q&A with Elle UK EIC Kenya Hunt about how the £149/year membership program Elle Collective can make up for falling newsstand revenue, future of magazines, more  —  Elle UK editor in chief Kenya Hunt explains why the future is bright for Elle magazine.

item.title: ソニー・ピクチャーズ・テレビジョンの制作責任者エド・ランミは、28年間務めた現職を2023年末に引退する予定だ（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
Sony Pictures Television's head of production Ed Lammi plans to retire at the end of 2023, after 28 years in his current position  —  No details were immediately available regarding who will replace Lammi as executive vice president of production, a role he has held since 1995.

item.title: ESPNが2020年のNBA選手ダミアン・リラードのクリップをデジタル加工し、バックスの開幕戦フィラデルフィア戦勝利後に掲載したことを確認（Julie DiCaro/Deadspin）
item.description:
Julie DiCaro / Deadspin:
ESPN confirms that it has digitally altered a clip of NBA player Damian Lillard from 2020 and posted it after the Bucks' opening night win against Philadelphia  —  The network's latest gaffe is terrifying, and likely only the beginning  —  Last week, after the Bucks' opening night win against Philadelphia …

item.title: モルドバ、TASSなどロシアメディアのウェブサイトを遮断、親欧米政権転覆のための情報戦の一環と非難（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
Moldova blocks the websites of TASS and other Russian media outlets, accusing them of being part of an information war to overthrow its pro-Western government  —  Moldova blocked access to the websites of major Russian news media including the Interfax and TASS news agencies on Monday …

item.title: 英国保守政治における長年の権力ブローカーであるテレグラフ紙の買い手候補に注目。DMGTは米国での同紙創刊を計画している（Joe Pompeo/Vanity Fair）
item.description:
Joe Pompeo / Vanity Fair:
A look at the prospective buyers of The Telegraph, a long-standing power broker in conservative UK politics; DMGT would plan to launch the paper in the US  —  Everyone from Rupert Murdoch to Mathias Döpfner to Lord Rothermere is eyeing the historic broadsheet, which is on the block for the first time in two decades.

item.title: アングリーバード』のような子供向けビデオゲームにイスラエル寄りのグラフィック広告が登場、イスラエルは10月7日のハマスの攻撃以来、オンライン広告に150万ドルを費やしている（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
Graphic pro-Israel ads are appearing in kids' video games, like Angry Birds, across Europe; Israel has spent $1.5M on online ads since Hamas' October 7 attack  —  Maria Julia Cassis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.

item.title: GroupM北米CEOのカーク・マクドナルド氏が3年後の2023年末に退社予定、後任はマインドシェアCEOのアダム・ガーハート氏が暫定的に就任（Digiday）
item.description:
Digiday:
GroupM North America CEO Kirk McDonald plans to leave at the end of 2023 after three years, replaced by Mindshare CEO Adam Gerhart on an interim basis  —  Kirk McDonald, who has served as the CEO of GroupM North America for the past three years, is leaving his position.

item.title: NYTの技術スタッフ700人の大半は、交渉なしに一方的に職場復帰計画を実施したことを非難し、本日半日の業務停止を予定している（Josh Eidelson/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Josh Eidelson / Bloomberg:
Most of the 700 NYT tech staff plan a half-day work stoppage today, accusing the outlet of unilaterally implementing a return-to-office plan without negotiating  —  - News giant's Tech Guild held half-day work stoppage Monday  — Workers include software engineers and product managers

item.title: メタ社は、EUの規制に対応するため、11月6日からEUおよび欧州の一部地域で18歳未満の全ユーザーへの広告表示を一時的に停止する予定（Sam Schechner/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Sam Schechner / Wall Street Journal:
Meta plans to temporarily suspend showing ads to all users under 18 in the EU and parts of Europe starting on November 6, to comply with EU regulations  —  Ad changes for Instagram and Facebook owner are aimed at navigating EU rules about targeted ads  —  Meta Platforms will stop showing adverts …

item.title: メタ社は、EU、EEA、スイスでインスタグラムとフェイスブックの広告なしオプションを提供する計画で、料金はウェブで9.99ユーロ／月、アンドロイドとiOSで12.99ユーロ／月（Jillian Deutsch/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Jillian Deutsch / Bloomberg:
Meta plans to offer an ad-free option for Instagram and Facebook in the EU, EEA, and Switzerland, charging €9.99/mo. on the web or €12.99/mo. on Android and iOS  —  - Plans cost €9.99 per month on the web, €12.99 on mobile  — The model follows increasing EU regulations on data access

item.title: 情報源：先週、銀行幹部とのプライベートな会合で、バイデンは、ガザの病院爆発の背後にイスラエルの空爆があると言ったNYTに激怒した（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: at a private meeting with bank executives last week, Biden fumed at the NYT for saying that an Israeli airstrike was behind the Gaza hospital explosion  —  The Scoop  —  President Joe Biden raged against The New York Times in a private White House meeting early last week …

item.title: 広告持株会社オムニコムが、英国のB2Bメディア、イベント、分析会社アセンシャルのデジタルコマース部門フライホイールを8億3500万ドルで買収予定（Megan Graham/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Megan Graham / Wall Street Journal:
Ad holding company Omnicom plans to acquire Flywheel, the digital commerce arm of UK-based B2B media, events, and analytics company Ascential, for ~$835M  —  Flywheel, part of Cannes Lions owner Ascential, aims to help brands sell on digital marketplaces such as Amazon

item.title: イスラエル国防軍はロイター通信とAFP通信に対し、ガザでの記者の安全は保証できないと伝えた。
item.description:
Mark Bendeich / Reuters:
The Israel Defense Forces tells Reuters and the AFP that the safety of their journalists in Gaza cannot be guaranteed, after the outlets sought assurances  —  Israel's military has told international news organisations Reuters and Agence France Presse that it cannot guarantee the safety …

item.title: トラック運転手、羊飼い、漁師といったブルーカラーのインフルエンサーたちは、自分の仕事の様子を短い動画で投稿することで多くの視聴者を集めている（Steven Kurutz/New York Times）。
item.description:
Steven Kurutz / New York Times:
A look at blue-collar influencers, including a trucker, a shepherd, and a fisherman, who have amassed large audiences by posting short videos of their workday  —  A new crop of popular social media personalities includes a trucker, a shepherd and a commercial fisherman.

item.title: 29,397人のアメリカ人を対象としたYouGovの調査：85％が少なくとも1冊の物理的書籍を所有、20％が1冊から10冊、14％が11冊から25冊、13％が26冊から50冊を所有、9％が100冊以上の電子書籍を所有していると回答（David Montgomery/YouGov）
item.description:
David Montgomery / YouGov:
YouGov survey of 29,397 Americans: 85% own at least one physical book, 20% own one to 10, 14% own 11 to 25, and 13% own 26 to 50; 9% say they own 100+ e-books  —  Whether you sort your books by genre, author's name, the Dewey Decimal System, or the color of the spine, you're in the minority.
